column1: This site had 2 gauges in the same position and the records overlap from 1876 to 1922 but this gauge, the Old Gauge, consistently records higher readings than the New Gauge averaging 2.8 inches. The difference is lower, at 1.1 inches, for the last years of the Old Gauge 1913 to 1922, but no obvious reason why.

The original record sheets have a note stating that the readings for 1891 and 1913 should be transposed. Looking at the readings it is obvious, given the differences between the gauges noted above, that the readings should be transposed and they have been in this record.
